intent_atoms.description: Investigator can navigate from an Integrity tab issue to the affected node in the Explorer outline.
Investigators can hide healthy branches and view only issue-bearing nodes using an "Issues only" filter toggle.
Keyboard shortcuts (Cmd+Shift+E / Cmd+Shift+Option+E) allow cycling through issue-bearing nodes in document order.
Selecting an Integrity issue expands ancestors, focuses the Explorer outline on the affected node, and maintains stable handoff between Integrity and Explorer tabs.
The "Issues only" toggle hides healthy branches while preserving sibling context for affected nodes.
Keyboard shortcuts cycle through issue-bearing nodes without conflicting with existing focus shortcuts.
Unit tests and preview‑driven QA cover the new filter mode and navigation helpers, ensuring deterministic behavior across fixtures.
The ParseTreeOutlineViewModel must always expose a consistent set of rows that include the affected node when an issue is selected.
Introduce a showsOnlyIssues flag in ParseTreeOutlineFilter to control visibility of healthy branches.
Use existing navigation helpers (rowID after .. …) and view model‑based navigation coordinator for keyboard shortcuts.
